[Bassim Draft Witness Statement.docx, p.1]
I make this declaration based upon my personal knowledge and upon a review of documents and correspondence kept in the ordinary course of business, except for those statements made upon information and belief, and these I believe to be true.

[Bassim Draft Witness Statement.docx, p.1]
After the Aircraft was finally returned to service by Gulfstream around November 29, 2024 (approximately 10 months after input), CITIOM eventually sold the Aircraft. However, due to the market conditions and the aircraft's troubled maintenance history resulting from the 192-month inspection, the final sale price was approximately $1 million less than the price agreed upon in the failed May 2024 agreement. This represents a direct financial loss caused by Gulfstream's failure to meet its commitments. [CITE RECENT SALE DOCUMENTS]. I understand the buyers, who were experienced aircraft operators, were shocked by the final invoice amount from the 192-month inspection.
